newsitem.title: VATICAN: Pope speaks out against "dangerous experiments".
newsitem.headline: Pope speaks out against "dangerous experiments".

text.p: Pope John Paul, in an apparent reference to the recent debate on cloning, spoke out on Sunday against all those who abused human dignity with "dangerous experiments".
The Pope, addressing pilgrims before his regular Sunday address at St Peter's Basilica, warned of "abuses of all kinds" threatening the dignity of life.

"We think, for example, of the lack of respect for life, which is sometimes subjected to dangerous experiments. We think of ecological pollution, the peddling of sex, drug trafficking and the abuse of the poor and of children," he said.
The Vatican last week called for a worldwide ban on human cloning after the creation of a cloned sheep by British scientists caused a furore.
The Roman Catholic Church opposes all forms of artificial human conception, including test-tube fertilisation and surrogate motherhood.
